events.title: Security Council LIVE: UN raises alarm over deadly Iran protests and ‘possible military strikes’
events.description: The UN Security Council is meeting in New York in emergency session on Iran, amid escalating concern over reports that hundreds have been killed during weeks of nationwide anti-government protests. The meeting was requested by the United States. Demonstrations that began in late December, fuelled by soaring inflation, rising food prices and the collapse of the national currency, triggered a deadly and widespread crackdown with thousands injured and detained, according to numerous firsthand accounts. The UN has called for independent investigations into all killings and warned against the possible use of the death penalty against protesters. Follow live coverage below, and UN News app users can go here.

events.title: Extreme rainfall inundates South Africa and Mozambique
events.description: Flood warning raised to highest level with roads washed away and rain forcing evacuation of Kruger national park Large areas of north-eastern South Africa and neighbouring Mozambique have been inundated for several days with exceptionally heavy rainfall. Some locations in South Africa recorded hundreds of millimetres of rain over the weekend, such as Graskop in Mpumalanga, where 113mm fell in 24 hours, and Phalaborwa, which recorded about 85mm of rainfall. Rain has continued to fall across the region since the weekend. The deluge has been driven by a slow-moving cut-off low pressure system that has remained anchored over the region, repeatedly drawing in moisture and triggering intense downpours. Further heavy rainfall is expected on Friday and over the weekend. Maputo, Mozambique’s capital, could expect daily rainfall totals to exceed 200mm by the end of Friday, while western parts of South Africa and north-western Eswatini may record more than 100mm. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran protest movement subsides amid intense crackdown
events.description: Protests in Iran have subsided after a crackdown that has killed thousands under an internet blackout, monitors said Friday, a week after the start of the largest demonstrations in years challenging the country's theocratic system. Siavosh Ghazi, FRANCE 24 Tehran correspondent, said Saturday that security forces remain largely present for a fifth consecutive day as official media continue to report arrests of people described as members of terrorist groups.

events.title: UN chief warns of a world in chaos as impunity and unpredictability spreads
events.description: In his final annual address outlining his priorities, UN Secretary-General António Guterres warned that the world is “brimming with conflict, impunity, inequality and unpredictability” – even as international cooperation is fraying at the moment it is most needed.

events.title: Iran: An uprising and a massacre, The Greenland narrative, Preventing WWIII
events.description: It’s been a week marked by brutality, brinkmanship and political theatre. In Iran, a third week of protests spiralled into a nationwide uprising as the regime shut down the internet and phone lines. Graphic accounts of a violent crackdown emerged via Elon Musk’s Starlink satellites, with human rights groups reporting thousands killed by Iran’s Revolutionary Guard in what they describe as an unprecedented massacre — even as President Trump urged protesters on, before appearing to shift his tone. Meanwhile, urgent diplomacy unfolded in the Arctic, as Denmark and Greenland pushed back against renewed US pressure to annex Greenland. President Trump insists America “needs” the island for strategic defence, prompting European allies to boost NATO’s presence — and leaving Greenland’s leadership confronting an unsettling new reality. And across Europe, politics turned volatile. France’s minority government survived two no-confidence votes sparked by anger over the EU’s Mercosur trade deal, as farmers clogged the country with tractor protests. In the UK, a dramatic defection saw a senior Conservative sacked and swiftly unveiled by Nigel Farage’s Reform party, while Prime Minister Keir Starmer added fresh bite to his rhetoric.

events.title: 'Victims of a slaughter: Iranian people have been rising up for decades against the Islamic regime'
events.description: Mark Owen welcomes Aida Tavakoli, co-founder of We Are Iranian Students, who offers a window into the humanitarian crisis unfolding in Iran under a blanket of state-imposed darkness. Her voice, urgent and unwavering, challenges the international community, including the UN Security Council, to rise up and take action in the face of "crimes against humanity." Ms. Tavakoli’s testimony underscores the deepening fracture between global democratic ideals and geopolitical pragmatism, raising uncomfortable questions about complicity, silence, and selective outrage. What emerges is a plea for action and an indictment of inaction.

events.title: Global employment stable but decent jobs in short supply
events.description: Global unemployment remains stable, but progress toward decent work has stalled, according to a new report from the International Labour Organization (ILO), which warns that young people continue to struggle in a job market which risks being further undermined by AI and trade policy uncertainty.

events.title: At least 32 killed as crane collapses on train in Thailand
events.description: Crane in use on high-speed rail project hits passing train, causing it to derail At least 32 people in Thailand have been killed and scores injured after a crane collapsed on to a passenger train and derailed it, officials said. Footage from the scene verified by Agence France-Presse showed the crane’s broken structure resting on giant concrete pillars and smoke rising from the wreckage of the train below. Continue reading...

events.title: More than 100 people die as torrential rain and flooding hit three countries
events.description: More than 100 people have been killed after torrential rain caused flooding across South Africa, Mozambique and Zimbabwe, with authorities issuing warnings that more severe weather is expected across several countries in southern Africa.

events.title: US-Europe standoff on Greenland 'a big win for Putin': Danish parliament defence chair
events.description: For US President Donald Trump, mocking a country or a leader is not just a reality TV-style soundbite, it is an early warning sign of military action. Trump scorned Nicolas Maduro for "playing tough" before snatching the Venezuelan leader. Now he contemptuously talks of Denmark "adding two more dogsleds" to defend Greenland. European countries do appear to be taking this latest threat seriously, but can they actually stop Trump from taking over Greenland? And how do they navigate this crisis when they must also stay focused on Ukraine? We put these questions to Rasmus Jarlov, chair of the defence committee in the Danish parliament.

events.title: Floods in South Africa force evacuations from famed Kruger National Park; 19 dead in other regions
events.description: Flooding caused by weeks of torrential rains in northern South Africa has forced the famed Kruger National Park to suspend visits and evacuate some guests and staff members

events.title: LIVE: Gaza death toll rises by Israeli raids, Trump names ‘Board of Peace’
events.description: Israeli raids cause rising casualties in Gaza, as attacks persist despite the ceasefire agreement.

events.title: Sydney awaits ‘soggiest weekend of summer’ as Victorian authorities defend flash flood warnings
events.description: Floods predicted for NSW south coast after severe storms dumped 180mm in six hours on Victoria’s Lorne and Wye River, washing cars into the sea on the Great Ocean Road Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Authorities have defended the timing of warnings for holidaymakers along Victoria’s surf coast who were hit by an “unprecedented” downpour on Thursday, as Sydney awaited its “soggiest weekend of summer” to date. Weatherzone forecasters predicted 20mm of rainfall was possible in Sydney on both Saturday and Sunday, which would be a record for the time of year. Continue reading...

events.title: Live: Death toll from Iran protests tops 3,000, HRANA rights group says
events.description: More than 3,000 people have been killed in the anti-government protests in Iran, another rights group reported Saturday. The US-based organisation HRANA said the authorities’ brutal crackdown appeared to have largely quelled the unrest. After more than 200 hours of an internet blackout, a monitoring group said it had noted "a very slight rise" in connectivity, but that there was still no sign of a significant return to normal service. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.

events.title: 'Massacre' as Uganda election descends into deadly violence - as opposition leader is 'taken away'
events.description: At least seven people have been killed as Uganda's presidential election descended into violence, with the opposition party saying their leader had been forcibly taken away.

events.title: UNRWA officials lobby congressional staffers against Trump terrorist designation threat
events.description: UNRWA officials briefed congressional staffers on potential Trump administration plans to designate the U.N. agency as a terrorist organization.

events.title: Iran's protests wane amid crackdown as US backs off intervention threats
events.description: The Iranian authorities' crackdown on nationwide protests has largely quieted the movement for now, residents said, as US President Donand Trump appears to have backed down from his threats of attacking Iran's leadership. Trump claimed on Friday that Iran had called off mass executions, while state media said that protesters were still being arrested.

events.title: Turkey says Syria using force is an option against US-backed fighters who helped defeat ISIS
events.description: Syria conflict escalates as Turkey warns Damascus may use force against Kurdish SDF fighters after deadly clashes near Aleppo reportedly killed 23.

events.title: Iran's protests appear increasingly smothered after a deadly crackdown
events.description: The nationwide protests challenging Iran's theocracy appear increasingly smothered a week after authorities shut the country off from the world and escalated a bloody crackdown.

events.title: Amid Sudan’s humanitarian crisis, Chad shows ‘act of solidarity’
events.description: In war-torn Sudan, local communities say they don’t have enough settlements for the internally displaced, few solutions for women who have suffered sexual violence – and there’s a lack of aid available for people with disabilities.

events.title: WFP warns Sudan food aid could run out in March
events.description: The World Food Programme (WFP) said on Thursday that it is struggling to keep emergency operations running in Sudan, where more than 1,000 days of war have pushed families to the brink.

events.title: Top Iran prayer leader who dubbed protesters 'Trump's soldiers' calls for executions amid ongoing unrest
events.description: Iranian cleric reportedly calls for death penalty against protesters as regime claims widespread damage to mosques and hospitals during nationwide unrest.

events.title: Myanmar begins defence in landmark genocide case at UN World Court
events.description: Myanmar on Friday rejected allegations of genocide against the Rohingya minority, telling the International Court of Justice (ICJ) that the Gambia’s case rests on “unsubstantiated allegations,” as public hearings continued in a landmark case on the application of the Genocide Convention.

events.title: Ohio dentist slayings suspect indicted on more aggravated murder, burglary charges
events.description: Michael McKee indicted on murder charges in fatal shootings of dentist Spencer Tepe and wife Monique in Columbus, Ohio, domestic violence case.

events.title: Game-changing international ocean treaty comes into force
events.description: Almost two decades in the making, an international agreement to protect and sustainably use marine life in international waters and the international seabed is due to come into force on Saturday, marking a major step forward in efforts to ensure the health of ocean ecosystems for decades to come.

events.title: Iran: UN urges ‘maximum restraint’ to avert more death, wider escalation
events.description: As nationwide protests in Iran appear to ease after nearly three weeks of unrest and bloodshed, a senior UN official called on Thursday for action to prevent further escalation.

events.title: World News in Brief: Escalating fighting in Sudan, displacement in Syria’s Aleppo, $1.5 billion appeal for South Sudan
events.description: More civilians in Sudan continue to be killed and displaced as fighting escalates in multiple parts of the country, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said on Tuesday.

events.title: Renee Good was shot 4 times, including in the head, fire report shows
events.description: Renee Good suffered four gunshot wounds in the fatal ICE-involved shooting, not three as initially reported, according to a Minneapolis fire incident report.

events.title: Armed Kurdish fighters try to breach Iran border as regional threat grows amid protests: reports
events.description: Turkey's intelligence agency, MIT, warned Iran's Revolutionary Guard about Kurdish fighters trying to cross the Iran-Iraq border during ongoing government crackdowns.

events.title: US air authority warns of ‘military activities’ over Mexico, South America
events.description: Warnings come as Mexico's Sheinbaum says 'compelling results' in tackling drug cartels, following Trump strike threats.

events.title: Filipino migrant worker’s death in NSW referred to federal police
events.description: Deputy state coroner concludes 21-year-old, who died after exiting a moving vehicle, was ‘exploited’ and exposed to ‘potentially criminal’ conduct in five weeks in Australia Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A New South Wales coroner has referred the death of a Filipino migrant worker, who died after jumping from a moving vehicle in 2019, to the Australian federal police to consider further investigations. NSW deputy state coroner Rebecca Hosking handed down the findings into the death of 21-year-old Jerwin Royupa on Friday. She concluded Royupa, a trainee at a winery, was “exploited” and exposed to “potentially criminal” conduct during his five weeks in Australia. Continue reading...

events.title: Federal judge restricts ICE agents amid ongoing Minneapolis area protests
events.description: Minnesota judge Kate Menendez bars ICE and Border Patrol from using tear gas against peaceful protesters during Operation Metro Surge in Minneapolis following deadly shooting of Renee Good.

events.title: US judge bars ICE from arresting peaceful Minnesota protesters or using pepper spray
events.description: A US Judge on Friday barred ICE agents from arresting peaceful protesters in Minnesota or using pepper spray against them. The ruling comes 10 days after an ICE officer killed 37-year-old Renee Good and another wounded a Venezuelan man a few days later.

events.title: Syria's Sharaa declares Kurdish a 'national language' following clashes
events.description: Syria's President Ahmed al-Sharaa on Friday declared Kurdish one of the country's national languages in the wake of recent clashes between the army and Kurdish forces in Aleppo. Kurds in north Syria have declined to integrate into the State calling instead for a decentralised federal system, which Damascus rejects.

events.title: Uganda’s opposition leader ‘taken by army’ as Museveni nears re-election
events.description: Bobi Wine flown to unknown location, his party says, hours after security forces allegedly killed 10 of his campaigners The Ugandan opposition leader Bobi Wine was taken from his house and brought to an unknown location on Friday, his party said as President Yoweri Museveni closed in on a landslide re-election. Wine’s National Unity Platform party said on Friday evening in a post on X that an army helicopter had landed in his compound in the capital, Kampala, and “forcibly taken him away to an unknown destination”. Continue reading...

events.title: Christian and Muslim faith leaders express ‘deep concerns’ about Labor bill’s impact on free speech – as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed Penny Wong says Sussan Ley’s leadership ‘unsalvageable’ after Coalition flags opposition to new hate laws Could Labor’s hate speech laws damage Australia’s free speech? Here’s what you need to know about the contentious bill Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Larissa Waters , the Greens’ leader, also says she’s concerned there has not been enough time to evaluate the legislation, warning there are a “raft of unintended consequences that could occur”. Waters told RN Breakfast: We’ve only had a handful of days to look at this legislation, and it’s very consequential legislation … And with every turn, experts and stakeholders and faith leaders and academics are finding new concerns with it. A key concern is that you can’t combat hate if you don’t combat it for everyone. A key concern that we have … is that these laws, as they’re drafted right now, could be weaponised to shut down legitimate political protest. Given the tightness of the timeframe … there is a real risk that locking in laws that aren’t right could criminalise people for legitimate political expression. That is a dangerous path. We’ve got serious concerns with respect to whether or not the bill meets its objective … It really is concerning that we’re in this stage where we’re less than one business day away from parliament coming together and these serious concerns persist. We’re in a situation where we’re dealing with such a significant piece of legislation, complicated legislation, legislation which deals with the raft of matters which are contained in this one monster omnibus bill, which is a totally inappropriate way to address this situation. Continue reading...

events.title: US issues 'military activity' flight advisory over Latin America
events.description: The warnings come as Trump has suggested possible military strikes against drug cartel targets in Mexico. However, Mexican authorities said the US advisory has no operational implications for Mexico.

events.title: Top Iranian general threatens to 'cut off' Trump's hand over potential military strikes
events.description: Senior Iranian official Mohsen Rezaei warns American military bases in the region would not be safe from retaliation as U.S. aircraft carrier reportedly moves toward Middle East.

events.title: Latin Kings gang member accused of vandalizing FBI vehicle, stealing government property in Minneapolis
events.description: Latin Kings gang member allegedly stole FBI body armor and weapons from a federal vehicle during unrest in Minneapolis following shootings involving ICE agents.

events.title: No sign of new protests in Iran as a hard-line cleric calls for executions
events.description: A Iran returns to an uneasy calm after protests led to a violent crackdown, a senior cleric is calling for the death penalty for detained demonstrators. His sermon Friday also threatened U.S. President Trump.

events.title: Cuba honors soldiers killed in Venezuela and other top photos from Latin America and the Caribbean
events.description: Jan. 9-15, 2026 The remains of 32 Cuban officers killed during a U.S. strike on Venezuela were repatriated to their homeland. The soldiers were part of the security detail of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro during the Jan. 3 raid on his residence to seize the former leader and bring him to the U.S. to face drug trafficking charges. Venezuela’s acting President Delcy Rodríguez used her first state of the union message to advocate for opening the crucial state-run oil industry to more foreign investment following the Trump administration’s pledge to seize control of Venezuelan crude sales. ___ This gallery was curated by photojournalist Moises Castillo, based in Guatemala City. ___ AP photography: https://apnews.com/photography Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/apnews

events.title: World News in Brief: Gaza education update, the General Assembly at 80, Venezuela’s humanitarian needs
events.description: More children in war-ravaged Gaza are now back in the classroom, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) said on Friday.

events.title: 11-year streak of record global warming continues, UN weather agency warns
events.description: The past 11 years have been the warmest in the modern era, while oceans continue to heat up, too, says the UN weather agency.

events.title: Nearly 50 Venezuelan soldiers killed in US abduction of President Maduro
events.description: Venezuela's Defence Ministry says 83 people in total killed in US attack to abduct President Nicolas Maduro.

events.title: Kurdish granted national language status in Syria
events.description: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa issued a decree on Friday declaring Kurdish a "national language", in an apparent gesture of good will towards the minority following clashes in recent days. The decree is the first formal recognition of Kurdish national rights since Syria's independence in 1946.

events.title: Civilians flee on foot as Syrian military offensive looms east of Aleppo
events.description: A trickle of civilians has left a contested area east of Aleppo after a Syrian military warning to evacuate

events.title: Aid cuts push millions in West and Central Africa deeper into hunger
events.description: A staggering 55 million people across West and Central Africa are expected to suffer crisis levels of hunger, or worse, during the lean season from June to August as funding cuts to humanitarian operations continue amid rising violence and displacement.

events.title: In Gaza, 800,000 people now live in dangerous locations prone to flooding
events.description: Fighting the harsh winter storms in Gaza, Amina stays awake at night, hitting the canvas of the tent above her head to prevent it from collapsing under the pooled water.

events.title: Myanmar’s Rohingya people called ‘Muslim dogs’ before attacks, ICJ hears
events.description: Hearings continued on Thursday at the UN’s top court into the Gambia’s claim that Myanmar committed genocide against the Rohingya people, with allegations that military officials incited violence through hate speech, calling the ethnic minority “Muslim dogs” who should be made “extinct”.

events.title: Yemen’s fragile calm unravels as hunger and aid restrictions deepen crisis
events.description: A fragile political calm in Yemen is fraying, with renewed instability and aid restrictions deepening hunger, illness and displacement for millions of civilians, senior UN officials warned the Security Council on Wednesday.

events.title: Secret Service aware after Iranian state TV airs Trump threat featuring photo of Butler assassination attempt
events.description: Iranian state TV allegedly aired threatening message against Trump, referencing his Butler assassination attempt with caption "this time, it won't miss."

events.title: A prosecutor’s child witnessed Charlie Kirk’s assassination — can he take part in the case?
events.description: Defense attorneys claim conflict of interest in Charlie Kirk assassination case after prosecutor's family member witnessed the shooting at public event.

events.title: Iran appears to reopen airspace after Trump says killing is 'stopping'
events.description: Iran appeared to reopen its airspace after a sudden overnight closure disrupted regional flights amid ongoing security warnings and mounting regional tensions.

events.title: Floods kill more than 100 across southern Africa as rains intensify
events.description: Torrential rains have devastated communities from Mozambique to South Africa, displacing hundreds of thousands.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: South Korean prosecutors demand death penalty for former president Yoon Suk Yeol
events.description: Yoon is on trial for insurrection charges, after trying to declare martial law in late 2024 South Korean prosecutors have demanded the death penalty for former president Yoon Suk Yeol over his failed martial law declaration in December 2024, in the first insurrection trial of a Korean head of state in three decades. Prosecutors characterised the case as the “serious destruction of constitutional order by anti-state forces”, telling Seoul central district court that Yoon had “directly and fundamentally infringed upon the safety of the state and the survival and freedom of the people”. Continue reading...

events.title: Does the US need to ‘own’ Greenland to build Trump's Golden Dome missile shield?
events.description: US President Donald Trump has described ownership of Greenland as “vital” to his planned missile defence shield, doubling down on the claim that the sprawling Danish territory is critical to US national security. But experts say Trump's costly Golden Dome can be built without seizing the world’s largest island.

events.title: East Jerusalem: Forced shutdown of UN clinic signals escalating disregard for international law
events.description: The temporary closure of a UN-run health centre in East Jerusalem is the latest phase in “a pattern of deliberate disregard” for international law, the head of the UN agency that assists Palestine refugees, UNRWA, said on Wednesday.

events.title: Exiled Iranian crown prince reveals 6-step plan to exert pressure on Tehran's regime
events.description: Exiled Iranian crown prince Reza Pahlavi outlined his 6-step plan to exert international pressure on the regime, describing it as being "close to collapse"

events.title: Trump’s push to acquire Greenland sparks international media frenzy on remote island
events.description: A surge of international media has descended on Greenland as President Trump renews his push to acquire the strategic Arctic island.

events.title: Exiled crown prince urges world to help protesters topple Iran's government
events.description: Reza Pahlavi, a US-based opposition figure, called on the world to target Iran's Revolutionary Guards leadership.

events.title: Rare twins born in DRC raise cautious hope for endangered mountain gorillas
events.description: Virunga park ranger says babies are well cared for by mother Mafuko but high infant mortality makes first weeks critical It was noon by the time Jacques Katutu first saw the newborn mountain gorillas. Cradled in the arms of their mother, Mafuko, the tiny twins clung to her body for warmth in the forest clearing in Virunga national park, in eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). Katutu, head of gorilla monitoring in Virunga, has seen dozens of newborns in his 15 years as a ranger. But, he tells the Guardian, even he was touched by the sight of the fragile infant males, who face serious obstacles if they are to become silverbacks one day. Continue reading...

events.title: Man armed with bow and arrow shot dead by NSW police
events.description: The incident at Gunnedah near Tamworth is the third fatality involving police in the state this year Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A man armed with a bow and arrow has been shot dead by police in New South Wales as they carried out a welfare check – the third fatality involving officers this year. Authorities attended the man’s house in Gunnedah near Tamworth on Friday at 1.40pm after receiving a call about concerns for his welfare. Continue reading...

events.title: Exiled Iranian women in Germany: 'All that remains is rage!'
events.description: Iran's regime has been cracking down on protesters with brutal force. Images of bodies in shrouds have provoked shock and outrage around the world — including among five Iranian women living in Germany.

events.title: Tanzania president remorseful over internet shutdown on election day
events.description: Tanzania’s president has, for the first time since the disputed October election, commented on a six-day internet shutdown that disrupted operations as the country went through its worst postelection violence

events.title: Florida teens buried alive in deadly sand tunnel collapse
events.description: Two 14-year-old best friends died when a sandpit collapsed on them at a Florida beach near Tampa. The boys were reportedly digging for fun.

events.title: 'I was hit in the face by pellets': Iranians on border describe violence and more protests
events.description: The BBC speaks to Iranians at the border with Iraq, as authorities continue to block the flow of information with an internet blackout.

events.title: US-Iran tensions: Trump has no path to an easy ‘win’ despite Tehran’s woes
events.description: Despite Iran's vulnerable position, any US strikes could risk triggering a protracted conflict, analysts say.

events.title: South Africa investigates Iran's participation in naval drills off its coast after US criticism
events.description: South Africa has launched an investigation over the participation of Iranian warships in naval drills off its coast

events.title: Peacekeeping: Lacroix warns of rising threats to ‘blue helmets’ in Middle East
events.description: Peacekeeping operations in the Middle East are facing mounting security risks, funding pressures and political uncertainty, the head of UN peacekeeping warned on Friday.

events.title: Passenger’s Wi-Fi name triggers bomb scare, forces Turkish Airlines emergency landing
events.description: Turkish Airlines flight makes emergency landing in Barcelona after passenger creates hoax bomb threat using Wi-Fi hotspot name. No explosives found.

events.title: US sending military assets to Middle East as Trump weighs Iran strike, sources say
events.description: A U.S. military aircraft carrier is in motion toward the Middle East amid rising tensions against the Iranian regime, well-placed military sources have confirmed to Fox News.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: At top UN court, Myanmar denies deadly Rohingya campaign amounts to genocide
events.description: Myanmar insists its military campaign against the Rohingya ethnic minority was a legitimate counter-terrorism operation, not genocide

events.title: Explosion damages homes and injures at least 4 in the Netherlands
events.description: An explosion in a residential street in Utrecht, Netherlands, has caused a blaze and widespread damage

events.title: The UN is ‘worth fighting for’: General Assembly President
events.description: With the multilateral system under pressure and under attack, Member States must fight for the United Nations, the President of the General Assembly said on Wednesday, laying out her priorities for its resumed 80th session.

events.title: Sudan: A truce of separation
events.description: The proposed humanitarian ceasefire in Sudan aims to undermine the unity of the country.

events.title: US judge orders curbs on ICE agents’ actions against Minnesota protesters
events.description: The court injunction bars federal ​agents from detaining or retaliating against peaceful protesters or observers.

events.title: 911 transcripts, documents detail chaotic scene after ICE agent fatally shot Renee Good
events.description: Renee Nicole Good suffered four gunshot wounds, according to newly released reports. Witnesses described the chaotic scene and said she was shot at 'point-blank' range.

events.title: ICE releases photos after violent Minneapolis protests leave multiple alleged agitators arrested
events.description: ICE released photos of four alleged agitators arrested on federal charges during Minneapolis protests outside the Bishop Henry Whipple Federal Building Thursday.

events.title: US justice department investigating Minnesota Democrats over alleged obstruction of ICE
events.description: It comes as fresh details emerged in the death of a Minneapolis woman shot last week by an ICE agent in the city.

events.title: Syria live news: Army takes control of east Aleppo towns as SDF pulls out
events.description: Army says its forces are working to remove mines and other war remnants as they continue advancement.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Canada PM hails strategic partnership with China to adapt to ‘new global realities’
events.description: Mark Carney holds talks with Xi Jinping on rare Beijing trip as Canada seeks to diversify trade links away from US Business live – latest updates Canada’s prime minister, Mark Carney, has hailed a “new strategic partnership” with China as he held talks in Beijing with President Xi Jinping , the first visit by a Canadian leader in eight years. Addressing Xi in the Great Hall of the People, Carney said: “Together we can build on the best of what this relationship has been in the past to create a new one adapted to new global realities.” Continue reading...

events.title: 'Not just trade': The EU-Mercosur megadeal
events.description: As the EU's share of the global market slips, the Mercosur deal could unlock access to critical raw materials. It's also indicative of a wider EU economic pivot.

events.title: Italy's Meloni posts anime selfie - as Japan PM serenades her for birthday
events.description: Giorgia Meloni might have a new best friend in world politics after Japan's prime minister laid on cake and gifts - and even sang happy birthday to the Italian leader.

events.title: Man accused of murdering woman and toddler in Munich car attack goes on trial
events.description: The Afghan suspect is accused of killing a 37-year-old woman and her two-year-old daughter.

events.title: Tragic death of Adichie's young son pushes Nigeria to act on health sector failings
events.description: Novelist Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie says her child's death was caused by medical negligence, which the hospital denies.

events.title: Cuba counts cost of alliance after 32 troops killed in Venezuela
events.description: The recent events in Venezuela have exposed the strategic risks of Cuba’s foreign entanglements.

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,423
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,423 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro finds novel way to reduce 27-year sentence: reading books
events.description: Former president convicted for coup plot to take advantage of law that knocks four days off jail term for each book read Jair Bolsonaro’s lawyers appear to have been reading up on the country’s penal code and have found a way to help their client reduce the 27-year prison sentence he received last year for plotting a coup: by reading books. There is only one problem: the former far-right Brazilian president has never been known as a bibliophile. “Sorry, I don’t have time to read,” Bolsonaro once declared. “It’s been three years since I read a book.” Continue reading...

events.title: South Korea sentences ex-president to five years in first martial law verdict
events.description: Yoon Suk Yeol’s conviction for obstructing own arrest separate from main trial that could lead to death penalty A South Korean court has sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in prison for mobilising presidential security forces to block his own arrest and abusing his powers. It is the first judicial ruling linked to the events surrounding his failed martial law declaration in December 2024. The ruling is separate from Yoon’s main insurrection trial, where prosecutors earlier this week sought the death penalty and a verdict is due next month. Continue reading...

events.title: How European cinema is stealing Hollywood's spotlight
events.description: As Hollywood doubles down on sequels, the contenders for the European Film Awards feature bold, political works that are challenging audiences and creating buzz far beyond the continent.

events.title: Trump taps Blair, Rubio for Gaza 'Board of Peace'
events.description: US President Donald Trump boasted it is the "Greatest and Most Prestigious Board ever assembled at any time, any place." The body will oversee the transitional government in the war-ravaged Palestinian territory.

events.title: WEF: Donald Trump set to dominate Davos 2026
events.description: Davos braces for Trump's return. Weeks after attacking Venezuela, capturing its controversial leader, and reviving Greenland ambitions, the US president's presence is expected to raise the stakes at WEF's annual meeting.

events.title: Livestream: The European Film Awards 2026
events.description: Who will win at the 2026 European Film Awards? You can watch the show live here on January 17, at 6 p.m. "Sirat" leads with the most nominations.

events.title: Trump taps Tony Blair, US military head for Gaza
events.description: US President Donald Trump on Friday gave a key role in post-war Gaza to former British prime minister Tony Blair and appointed a US officer to lead a nascent security force.

events.title: Key accuser in Alexander brothers rape case dies just one week before federal trial begins: report
events.description: Kate Whiteman, who first accused Oren and Alon Alexander of rape, has died in Australia. The twins, along with their older brother, await their criminal trial this month.

events.title: Defense argues conflict of interest exists in Charlie Kirk’s assassination case and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Suspect accused of killing sleeping passenger on Chicago train filmed himself carrying out attack: prosecutors
events.description: Chicago man accused of stabbing sleeping passenger on a train allegedly recorded the deadly attack, prosecutors say. Victim had no interaction.

events.title: Trump launches phase 2 of Gaza peace plan — but Hamas disarmament remains the real test
events.description: Trump launches phase two of Gaza plan focusing on demilitarization Hamas and reconstruction, but experts warn disarming Hamas remains decisive challenge.

events.title: Iran enters uneasy calm after deadly anti-regime protests
events.description: A tense calm hangs over Iran after a wave of protests drew a bloody crackdown that reportedly left thousands of people dead.

events.title: Uganda: preliminary results begin to emerge
events.description: In tonight's edition, in Uganda, the preliminary results of the presidential election are beginning to emerge, indicating that President Museveni holds a substantial lead. Also in South Africa, a major multinational naval exercise has wrapped up in Cape Town. And finally, the Africa Cup of Nations is down to its final showdown.

events.title: Machado vows to lead Venezuela 'when right time comes'
events.description: The opposition leader says she has a mandate to lead the country after the US seized its president.

events.title: Julio Iglesias denies sexual assault allegations
events.description: In a statement, the Spanish singer says the allegations are "absolutely false and deeply sadden me".

events.title: Syria decree grants Kurds new rights, formally recognising Kurdish language
events.description: The decree is the first formal recognition of Kurdish national rights since Syria's independence in 1946.

events.title: Uganda’s army denies abducting Bobi Wine amid disputed election
events.description: National Unity Platform said opposition presidential candidate was seized from his home following the presidential vote.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Trump administration says deporting college student trying to surprise family was a ‘mistake’
events.description: Any Lucía López Belloza was detained at Boston’s airport in November and flown to Honduras two days later US citizens and permanent residents: have you been racially profiled by ICE? The Trump administration apologized in court for a “mistake” in the deportation of a Massachusetts college student who was detained trying to fly home to surprise her family in Texas for Thanksgiving. But the administration still argued that the federal government error should not affect her immigration case. Continue reading...

events.title: CIA chief visits Maduro successor as Machado vows to become Venezuela’s president
events.description: John Ratcliffe meets Delcy Rodríguez in Caracas less than two weeks after his agents helped to oust her precedessor The CIA chief whose agents reputedly played a key role in abducting Nicolás Maduro has flown to Venezuela to meet his successor as the sidelined opposition leader, María Corina Machado, vowed she would become the country’s first elected female president. Machado’s comments were broadcast on Friday, a day after she handed her Nobel peace prize medal to Donald Trump in recognition of what she called a principled and decisive move against Maduro, whom US special forces snatched on 3 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela's Machado says she presented her Nobel Peace Prize to Trump during their meeting
events.description: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado said she presented her Nobel Peace Prize medal to President Donald Trump at the White House on Thursday even as he has questioned her credibility to take over her country after the U.S. ousted then-President Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Venezuelan opposition member Freddy Guevara talks about the future of his country
events.description: Freddy Guevara, former vice president of the Venezuelan Parliament and a member of the Venezuelan opposition, talks about what's next for his country.

events.title: Title 'inseparably' linked to person, Nobel Institute says
events.description: Nobel prize title 'remains inseparably linked to the person,' organizers of the prize said in statement, after Maria Corina Machado gifted her peace prize medal to Donald Trump.

events.title: CIA chief meets Venezuela's interim leader to discuss 'potential opportunities'
events.description: The head of the CIA travelled to Venezuela and met the country's interim leader Delcy Rodriguez for about two hours, a US official said Friday. The visit from the senior US official was called a "trust-building measure" in the wake of the shock ouster of Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro on January 3.

events.title: 'An occupying force': Minneapolis caught up in Trump’s anti-immigration surge
events.description: Masked agents from multiple agencies have turned Minneapolis into a testing ground for the Trump administration’s most aggressive anti-immigration strategy yet. A multi-billion surge in federal funding has turbo-charged an operation built on escalation, confusion and spectacle, with ICE-led interventions turning deadly.

events.title: ‘Soft-power diplomacy’: Denmark hosts US delegation amid Trump's Arctic threats
events.description: Denmark’s leaders are trying their hand at “soft-power diplomacy” as they host a US delegation in Copenhagen, Danish journalist Trine Villemann told FRANCE 24. Eleven US lawmakers are visiting the city on Friday to express support for Denmark and Greenland, emphasising that President Donald Trump’s designs on the Arctic island do not have the backing of the American people.

events.title: Russia: successive snowstorms engulf far eastern region of Kamchatka
events.description: Heavy snow is not uncommon in Kamchatka, but the unusual intensity of the storms has left the region's major city partially paralysed. Snow piles reached three metres high, and sometimes even more. Schools have shut and businesses have switched to remote working. #snow #russia #storm

events.title: Fire breaks out in Seoul's last-remaining shanty town
events.description: A fire in one of Seoul's last-remaining shanty towns has burned makeshift houses and forced dozens of residents to flee

events.title: Illegal alien with 24 convictions among ‘worst of the worst’ arrested in Minnesota ICE operation: DHS
events.description: Federal agents arrested criminal illegal aliens as the DHS blasted Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz for allegedly protecting dangerous offenders through sanctuary policies.

events.title: The border in your backyard: Mexican cartels fuel record fentanyl, meth busts in Rocky Mountain states
events.description: The DEA reported record drug seizures in mountain states after 8.7 million fentanyl pills and 3,100 pounds of methamphetamine were confiscated during 2025 operations.

events.title: Japan's Prime Minister Takaichi plans to dissolve Parliament and call early election to strengthen coalition
events.description: Japan's first female Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, plans a snap election to capitalize on 70% approval ratings and strengthen her coalition majority.

events.title: Trump threatens new tariffs on countries opposed to Greenland takeover
events.description: The president made the threat while a bipartisan group of US lawmakers were visiting Denmark in the hope of easing tensions over the territory.

events.title: Syrian army enters areas east of Aleppo as Kurds withdraw
events.description: The Syrian army announced that it had taken control of Deir Hafer, a town previously under Kurdish control located east of Aleppo.

events.title: Most Germans see Trump's policies as threat to NATO
events.description: A majority of Germans say President Donald Trump's approach to foreign policy endangers the NATO alliance, according to a new survey.

events.title: Cyprus: Small and divided but with grand plans for the EU
events.description: One of the smallest members of the EU now holds the rotating presidency of the Council of the EU. The Cypriot government wants to promote European autonomy over the next six months.

events.title: X outages reported by thousands of users primarily in US
events.description: X was back up and running after about an hour after users began reporting connectivity issues. The site was also down briefly earlier this week.

events.title: German firms hunker down as Trump marks one year in office
events.description: One year into Donald Trump's second term, higher tariffs and sharper threats are straining transatlantic business. German companies in the US are weighing compliance against resistance as uncertainty grows.

events.title: Iran protest crackdown: What are the US's military options?
events.description: Since the start of the latest wave of protests in Iran, Donald Trump has been back and forth on US intervention. With the situation changing constantly, what do experts think are the options for the US in Iran?

events.title: Ugandan opposition denounces army raid on opposition leader Bobi Wine
events.description: The party of Uganda's main opposition leader Bobi Wine denounced a raid by security forces on his home on Friday amid reports Wine has been cut off from all communication. The raid comes just before the announcement of the results of the presidential election expected on Saturday.

events.title: 'People power' opposition supporters shout as voting count in Uganda election turns violent
events.description: Heavily-armed military officers yell at us to kneel on the ground in front of the shuttered shop fronts facing Kibuye roundabout in central Kampala as the jolting sounds of gunfire and stun grenades ring out.

events.title: Mexican president highlights 'compelling results' in crackdown of cartels in face of Trump threats
events.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum says that efforts to crack down on Mexican cartels and slow migration north were showing “compelling results” in an effort to head off intervention by the Trump administration

events.title: Ukraine: Families in ‘survival mode’ amid Russian strikes and deadly cold
events.description: Families across Ukraine are in “constant survival mode” amid ongoing waves of Russian missile and drone strikes that have left blocks without power for days at a time, while temperatures plunge to deadly lows, the UN Children's Fund (UNICEF) said on Friday.

events.title: In Haiti’s storm-hit south, food vouchers restore choice and dignity for families
events.description: Standing outside a colourfully painted building in southeastern Haiti, at the entrance to a bustling shop called Gods Will Depot where bags of food are stacked to the ceiling, Ketia surveys the large pile of groceries she has selected for her family: a big sack of flour, packages of spaghetti, boxed milk, some bars of soap.

events.title: Cat caught on camera starting dangerous kitchen fire after jumping on stove and turning on burner
events.description: Surveillance video captured the moment a cat turned on a stove burner in Garland, Texas, igniting items and causing extensive kitchen damage to the home.

events.title: Georgian demonstrators watch Iran closely as their own protests grind on
events.description: Georgians display Iranian Lion and Sun flags during daily protests in Tbilisi, showing solidarity with Iranian demonstrators while opposing EU accession halt by their government.

events.title: Iran's ethnic minorities could hold key to regime's fate as protests continue
events.description: Iran's ethnic minorities, comprising nearly 50% of the population, could prove decisive in ongoing anti-regime protests as Kurdish groups lead resistance.

events.title: Blair and Rubio among names on Gaza 'Board of Peace'
events.description: The former UK prime minister and US secretary of state will sit on the "founding executive board", the White House says.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: China reports record trillion-dollar trade surplus despite Trump tariffs
events.description: Results for 2025 risk further unsettling economies about China’s trade practices and overcapacity, and their own over-reliance on Chinese products China has reported a strong export run in 2025 with a record trillion-dollar surplus, as its producers brace for three more years of a Trump administration set on slowing the manufacturing powerhouse by shifting US orders to other markets. Beijing’s resilience to renewed tariff tensions since Donald Trump returned to the US presidency last January has emboldened Chinese firms to shift their focus to south-east Asia, Africa and Latin America to offset US duties. Continue reading...

events.title: Canada agrees to cut tariff on Chinese EVs in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products
events.description: Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.

events.title: Denmark invites US to participate in drills alongside NATO allies
events.description: The United States has been invited to take part in military exercises in Greenland alongside NATO allies, the head of Denmark's Joint Arctic Command told AFP on Friday. This comes after European countries sent small numbers of military personnel to Greenland in a show of support on Thursday.

events.title: Hundreds flee to government-held areas in north Syria ahead of possible offensive
events.description: Scores of people have fled to government-held areas in northern Syria

events.title: Trump's pick for Iceland ambassador apologizes for joking about Arctic nation becoming 52nd state
events.description: Former Rep. Billy Long, who was nominated by President Donald Trump to be ambassador to Iceland, apologized after privately joking that the island would become the "52nd state."

events.title: Paracetamol is safe in pregnancy, says study refuting Trump autism claims
events.description: Researchers say their gold-standard review should put an end to the debate over use of the common painkiller during pregnancy.

events.title: US accuses South Africa military of 'cosying up to Iran'
events.description: The defence minister orders an inquiry into reports the military flouted orders to expel Iran from naval drills.

events.title: Minneapolis mayor says reported DOJ probe ‘intimidation’ amid ICE raids
events.description: Reports of Trump administration investigating top Democrats in Minnesota as violent ICE crackdown continues.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Denmark and U.S. to form working group to talk about U.S. security concerns
events.description: After meeting with President Trump's top aides, Danish officials say they will form a working group to talk through U.S. security concerns about control of Greenland.

events.title: Ohio dentist murders gun match a ‘big problem’ for surgeon ex: Defense attorney
events.description: Evidence allegedly links gun from accused surgeon Michael McKee's property to Ohio dentist double murder, creating a "big problem" for defense.

events.title: Venezuela’s acting president touts ‘new political moment,’ hints at further release of political prisoners
events.description: Venezuela's new leadership hints at additional prisoner releases amid political transition, with hundreds of detainees reportedly still in custody.

events.title: Photos: Syrian army enters Deir Hafer after SDF withdrawal
events.description: Government troops enter the city earlier controlled by the SDF, marking a shift in territorial control in Aleppo region.

events.title: LIVE: Manchester United vs Manchester City – Premier League
events.description: Follow our live build-up, with team news coverage, ahead of our text commentary stream of the derby at Old Trafford.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Syrian forces enter Deir Hafer near Aleppo after Kurdish fighters agree to withdraw
events.description: Syrian government forces on Saturday entered Deir Hafer, east of Aleppo, after Kurdish-led fighters agreed to evacuate the town in a move to avoid further confrontation. Last week, the Syrian army drove Kurdish forces out of Aleppo following deadly clashes.

events.title: Japanese mayor apologises after calling staff 'human scum'
events.description: Yokohama mayor Takeharu Yamanaka admits using the terms "idiot" and "human scum" to disparage staff.

events.title: Police deny claims Uganda opposition leader abducted by helicopter
events.description: President Yoweri Museveni has a commanding lead with most votes counted as his main rival Bobi Wine decries "fake results".

events.title: CIA director had two-hour meeting with new Venezuelan leader in Caracas
events.description: The pair discussed economic opportunities and preventing Venezuela becoming a place for "America's adversaries", a US official said.

events.title: China and Canada announce tariffs relief after a high-stakes meeting between Carney and Xi
events.description: Canola oil and electric cars are at the centre of the deal agreed by Mark Carney and Xi Jinping after years of strained ties.

events.title: Myanmar begins defence in landmark genocide case at UN court
events.description: Myanmar says The Gambia has failed to provide enough evidence of genocide against the Muslim-minority people.

events.title: S Korea's ex-president Yoon to be jailed for five years over martial law bid
events.description: This is the first of the verdicts in the four trials linked to Yoon's shock decree in 2024.

events.title: Landscape beneath Antarctica's icy surface revealed in unprecedented detail
events.description: Scientists believe the map could shed light on how Antarctica's vast ice sheet will respond to climate change.

events.title: Actor Timothy Busfield charged with sexually abusing boys on set of TV series
events.description: The actor starred in the West Wing TV series and is also known for the baseball film Field of Dreams.

events.title: Clippers rally past Raptors in OT for fifth straight NBA win
events.description: Los Angeles Clippers overcome a 14-point deficit to beat Toronto Raptors 121-117, while Nets and Cavaliers also win.

events.title: AFCON, Colonialism and Lumumba
events.description: A Congolese fan stood for 90 minutes to honour Patrice Lumumba, a man who stood for independence and paid for it

events.title: Mother of Elon Musk’s child sues his AI company over Grok deepfake images
events.description: Ashley St Clair, mother of Musk's son, Romulus, sues over 'pain and mental distress' caused by fake AI images.

events.title: Can the US afford Trump’s $1.5 trillion ‘dream military’?
events.description: Donald Trump plans to boost US military spending to $1.5 trillion in 2027. His plan to pay for it does not add up.

events.title: Myanmar military-backed party leads after second round of election voting
events.description: Critics, including human rights and opposition groups, say election is neither free nor fair.

events.title: Trump to pardon former Puerto Rico Governor Wanda Vazquez after plea deal
events.description: Vazquez accepted a plea deal in 2025 after she was accused of participating in a bribery scheme while in office.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Controversial US study on hepatitis B vaccines in Africa is cancelled
events.description: $1.6m project drew outrage over ethical questions about withholding vaccines proven to prevent disease The controversial US-funded study on hepatitis B vaccines among newborns in Guinea-Bissau has been halted, according to Yap Boum, a senior official at the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). “The study has been cancelled,” Boum told journalists at a press conference on Thursday morning. Continue reading...

events.title: Cloth wraps treated with ‘dirt cheap’ insecticide cut malaria cases in babies
events.description: Soaking fabrics in a commonly used insect repellent is a simple and effective tool as mosquito bites become more common during daytime, study shows From Africa to Latin America to Asia, babies have been carried in cloth wraps on their mothers’ backs for centuries. Now, the practice of generations of women could become a lifesaving tool in the fight against malaria. Researchers in Uganda have found that treating wraps with the insect repellent permethrin cut rates of malaria in the infants carried in them by two-thirds. Continue reading...

events.title: Julio Iglesias denies sexual abuse claims of two former female employees
events.description: Women allege Spanish singer subjected them ‘to inappropriate touching, insults and humiliation … in atmosphere of control’ The Spanish singer Julio Iglesias has broken his silence over allegations that he sexually abused two women who worked in his Caribbean mansions, saying he has never “abused, coerced or disrespected any woman”. The 82-year-old entertainer, whose career spans six decades, had been accused by two female former employees who allege they had been sexually assaulted and subjected “to inappropriate touching, insults and humiliation … in an atmosphere of control and constant harassment”. Continue reading...

events.title: US says it reached deal with Taiwan to lower tariffs and boost investments
events.description: US to lower tariffs on Taiwanese goods to 15% as chip and tech businesses pledge $250bn spending in US operations The US said on Thursday that it had signed a deal with Taiwan to reduce tariffs on goods from the democratic island, while increasing Taiwanese semiconductor and tech companies’ investments in America. The agreement, the US commerce department said, “will drive a massive reshoring of America’s semiconductor sector”. Continue reading...

events.title: Damien Martyn declares ‘I’m back!’ after leaving hospital following meningitis
events.description: In a social media post, the former Australia batter revealed he had been given a ‘50/50 chance of surviving’ and thanked medical staff and well-wishers Damien Martyn has declared he is back after overcoming a meningitis scare, which he said took his life out of his hands. In a heartfelt post on his social media accounts, the former Australia batter said he was given a 50% chance to live after battling the disease, which causes an infection and swelling of fluid and membranes around the brain and spinal cord. The 54-year-old was put into an induced coma on 27 December and was fighting for his life in a Gold Coast intensive care unit until he woke eight days later. Continue reading...

events.title: M 6.0 - 295 km W of Bandon, Oregon
events.description: PAGER - GREEN ShakeMap - I DYFI? - IV Time 2026-01-16 03:25:52 UTC 2026-01-16 03:25:52 UTC at epicenter Location 43.543°N 128.009°W Depth 10.00 km (6.21 mi)

events.title: A South Korean court sentences Yoon to 5 years in prison on charges related to martial law decree
events.description: A South Korean court has sentenced former President Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in prison, the first verdict in eight criminal trials for allegations that include his 2024 martial law decree.

events.title: European troops arrive in Greenland to boost the Arctic island's security
events.description: Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland after talks between Denmark, Greenland and the U.S. on Wednesday highlighted disagreement.

events.title: What Teddy Roosevelt has to do with Trump's moves in Venezuela and Greenland
events.description: Presidents James Monroe and Theodore Roosevelt helped shape a policy that rationalizes U.S. intervention in Latin America and elsewhere. But Trump has brought that idea to a whole new level.

events.title: Uganda goes to the polls amid heavy security and internet blackout
events.description: Ugandans are voting in a tense presidential election as 81-year-old President Yoweri Museveni seeks to extend his four-decade rule amid an internet shutdown and heavy military deployment.

events.title: How are ICE agents recruited, and who are they?
events.description: Donald Trump's second presidential term has seen a rapid rise in the number of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents. But who are these people, and where is the US government finding them?

events.title: Iran's exiled crown prince asks Europe's help to end regime
events.description: The eldest son of the last shah, Reza Pahlavi, has said Iran's regime is on its "last legs" and called on countries to take action in support of demonstrators.

events.title: 2026 stargazing: Eclipses, meteor showers and supermoons
events.description: 2026 will leave stargazers spoiled for sights in the sky, with four eclipse events, multiple meteor showers and several supermoons.

events.title: Munich Security Conference withdraws Iran's invitations
events.description: Organizers of the Munich Security Conference have reversed a decision to invite Iranian leadership figures after deadly crackdowns. Officials said the conditions for meaningful dialogue were "no longer in place."

events.title: Fact check: Woman burning Khamenei photo not in Iran
events.description: A viral video shows a woman lighting her cigarette from a burning photo of Iran's leader. Many claim it was filmed secretly in Tehran. The image is real; however, it's not from Iran.

events.title: AFCON 2025: Clash of the fallen giants as Egypt Face Nigeria
events.description: The Super Eagles and the Pharaohs meet this Saturday in Casablanca for the Africa Cup of Nations third-place playoff. A showdown between two heavyweights left disappointed, both sides will be desperate to bow out of the tournament with pride restored.

events.title: Tony Blair to oversee Gaza's future as part of Trump's 'greatest and most prestigious' Board of Peace
events.description: Sir Tony Blair will oversee the future of the Gaza Strip as part of the "greatest and most prestigious board ever assembled", Donald Trump has said.

events.title: 'Venezuela is going to be free', says opposition leader Machado
events.description: Venezuela's opposition leader said she is "confident" Nicolas Maduro's "criminal" regime will be dismantled and free elections will be held.

events.title: Julio Iglesias responds to sex abuse and trafficking allegations
events.description: Julio Iglesias has denied abusing two former domestic employees behind a criminal complaint against him, calling the accusations "completely false".

events.title: We can learn a lot from Antarctica's weird biology
events.description: Even though it's high summer in the Antarctic, the ocean around the Rothera research station is -1 Celsius.

events.title: Machado gave Trump her Nobel Peace Prize medal in pursuit of a greater prize
events.description: The Nobel Peace Prize means a lot to Maria Corina Machado but, clearly, giving it away means even more.

events.title: South Korea's ex-president jailed for five years over martial law declaration
events.description: The former president of South Korea, Yoon Suk Yeol, has been sentenced to five years in prison on charges relating to his failed martial law declaration.

events.title: British police force chief behind decision to ban Maccabi fans from Aston Villa match retires
events.description: A British police force chief has retired following criticism over a decision to ban Maccabi Tel Aviv fans from a match against Aston Villa last year

events.title: Trump says he may punish countries with tariffs if they don’t back the US controlling Greenland
events.description: President Donald Trump says he may punish countries with tariffs if they don’t back the U.S. controlling Greenland

events.title: Russian court considers central bank's $232B lawsuit against Euroclear over seized assets
events.description: A court in Moscow has started considering a lawsuit filed by Russia’s Central Bank against Euroclear, the Brussels-based clearing house that holds the bulk of Moscow’s frozen assets in Europe

events.title: Julio Iglesias denies sexual abuse allegations, calling them 'absolutely untrue'
events.description: Julio Iglesias has denied allegations of sexual assault made by two former employees

events.title: Vote counting underway in Uganda as opposition leader criticizes process
events.description: Vote counting is underway in Uganda’s tense presidential election, which took place amid an internet shutdown and voting delays

events.title: In their words: Greenlanders talk about Trump's desire to own their Arctic island
events.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has turned Greenland into a geopolitical hotspot with his demands to own it

events.title: China's Xi Jinping and Canada's Mark Carney seek new chapter in relations
events.description: China and Canada have pledged to improve relations after years of tension

events.title: Venezuelans in Spain are caught between hope and fear after Maduro's capture
events.description: Venezuelans in Spain are reacting to the news of Nicolas Maduro's capture by U.S. forces with mixed emotions

events.title: New Czech government of populist leader Andrej Babiš wins a mandatory confidence vote
events.description: The Czech Republic's new government of populist Prime Minister Andrej Babiš has won a confidence vote in Parliament

events.title: France's Macron laughs off 'harmless' eye condition as he addresses troops
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron joked about an unintentional “Eye of the Tiger” during his New Year address to France's armed forces

events.title: Former TV anchor accused of killing her mother ruled incompetent, murder case put on hold
events.description: Former TV news anchor accused of killing her mother ruled mentally incompetent for trial. Angelynn Mock allegedly stabbed 80-year-old mother on Halloween.

events.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Virginia nanny's story, dentist murders charges, Barry Morphew's plea
events.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.

events.title: Smiling anti-ICE agitator accused of punching Florida trooper as DeSantis asserts, 'This is not Minneapolis'
events.description: An anti-ICE agitator allegedly punched a trooper in the face, Florida Attorney General James Uthmeier said, noting, "We don't put up with this nonsense."

events.title: Photos reveal Virginia nanny took slain wife’s place in master bedroom weeks after love triangle murders
events.description: Investigators testify in Brendan Banfield murder trial as ex-IRS agent accused of killing wife Christine and Joseph Ryan in Virginia. Prosecutors say he moved mistress into bedroom.

events.title: Australia removes 4.7M kids from social media platforms in first month of historic ban
events.description: Australia says millions of underage social media accounts were shut down in the first month after a sweeping new ban on users under 16 took effect.

events.title: Latin America rebel groups urged to form 'super guerrilla' alliance against Trump
events.description: Nestor Gregorio Vera urges rival factions to unite against U.S. intervention after Venezuela strongman's capture.

events.title: Former Ukrainian PM accused of bribing politicians with US dollars to weaken Zelenskyy's government
events.description: Ukrainian authorities seized stacks of U.S. dollars during raids targeting former Prime Minister Yulia Tymoshenko, who allegedly planned to bribe lawmakers

events.title: Troops from Europe deploy to Greenland in rapid 2-day mission as Trump eyes US takeover
events.description: European countries are deploying military personnel to Greenland for a quick mission as the Trump administration is pushing to acquire the Danish territory.
